texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Getting Fedora 16 working in XenServer isn't the easiest thing to do, but I've put together a  repository on GitHub  that should help. The repository contains a kickstart file along with some brief instructions to help with the installation. If you're ready to get started right now, just clone the repository:
texts.text: Getting Fedora 16 working in XenServer isn't the easiest thing to do, but I've put together a  repository on GitHub  that should help. The repository contains a kickstart file along with some brief instructions to help with the installation. If you're ready to get started right now, just clone the repository:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: There are some big issues with Fedora 16 which cause problems for installations within XenServer:
texts.text: There are some big issues with Fedora 16 which cause problems for installations within XenServer:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: the installer sets up a console on something other than hvc0
texts.text: the installer sets up a console on something other than hvc0

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: anaconda won't start without being in serial mode
texts.text: anaconda won't start without being in serial mode

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: anaconda tries to use GPT partitions by default
texts.text: anaconda tries to use GPT partitions by default

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: grub2 is now standard, but it causes problems for older XenServer versions
texts.text: grub2 is now standard, but it causes problems for older XenServer versions

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My kickstart works around the grub2 problem by throwing down an old-style grub configuration file and creating the proper symlinks. This config will still be updated when you upgrade kernels (at least in Fedora 16). It also sets up a very simple partitioning schema with one root and one swap partition. A DOS partition table is used in lieu of a GPT partition table.
texts.text: My kickstart works around the grub2 problem by throwing down an old-style grub configuration file and creating the proper symlinks. This config will still be updated when you upgrade kernels (at least in Fedora 16). It also sets up a very simple partitioning schema with one root and one swap partition. A DOS partition table is used in lieu of a GPT partition table.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: When you start the installation, be sure to review the  README.md  in the git repository. It has some special instructions for boot options to meet the requirements of Fedora 16 and the kickstart file.
texts.text: When you start the installation, be sure to review the  README.md  in the git repository. It has some special instructions for boot options to meet the requirements of Fedora 16 and the kickstart file.
